name: Data entry clerks
lead statement: Data entry clerks input coded, statistical, financial and other information into computerized databases, spreadsheets or other templates using a keyboard, mouse, or optical scanner, speech recognition software or other data entry tools. They are employed in the private and public sectors.
example titles: interpreting machine operator â€“ data entry
main duties: Receive and register invoices, forms, records and other documents for data capture
Input data into computerized databases, spreadsheets or other templates using a keyboard, mouse, or optical scanner, speech recognition software or other data entry tools
Import and/or export data between different kinds of software
Verify accuracy and completeness of data
Identify, label and organize electronic storage media
Maintain libraries of electronic storage media.
employment requirements: Completion of secondary school may be required.
College or other courses in data entry may be required.
additional information: Progression to senior positions is possible with experience.

exclusions.name: Supervisors, general office and administrative support workers (1211)
